title: FDA Holds Off Approval of New Merck Arthritis Drug
description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Merck   Co. on Friday said U.S.  regulators won't approve its experimental arthritis drug  Arcoxia until the company provides more data showing it is safe  and effective.

title: US Airways seeks order to prohibit walkouts
description: US Airways Group Inc. will seek a court injunction to prohibit a strike by disaffected unions that have threatened a walkout if a bankruptcy judge grants the airline's request to cancel their labor contracts.

title: Shortage of steel forces halt at Nissan
description: TOKYO Nissan Motor said on Thursday that a shortage of steel would force it to halt production temporarily at three of its four auto factories in Japan, a highly unusual step the company said was made necessary in part by a surge in demand for steel from

title: Court Upholds RIM Patent Infringement, Sends Case Back for Further <b>...</b>
description: The three-year patent dispute between BlackBerry device maker Research In Motion Ltd. and patent holding company NTP Inc. isn #39;t over yet.

title: Update 1: Interbrew Shareholders Back Ambev Linkup
description: Shareholders of Belgian brewer Interbrew SA gave unanimous backing Friday to the linkup of their family company with Brazil #39;s Ambev to form the world #39;s largest brewer by volume.

title: HBOS voices Abbey concerns
description: HBOS today assumed a spoiler #39;s role in Santander Central Hispano #39;s 8.3bn takeover of Abbey National by highlighting the Spanish bank #39;s ties to the Royal Bank of Scotland.

title: BusinessWeek editor to CUNY
description: Stephen B. Shepard, the longtime editor in chief of BusinessWeek magazine, will retire in April to become the founding dean of the new Graduate School of Journalism at the City University of New York.

title: The Party Of Blind Hatred, Hypocrisy And Hysteria
description: A generation ago or more, the Democratic Party was considered the Party of the little guy, promoting issues that directly impacted, and were supported by the average American, the majority.

title: Aviation Fight Mirrors Larger French-German Rivalry
description: In the global aerospace race, Europe has stolen a march on the United States, winning a flurry of contracts for Airbus planes and developing a new midsize jet to compete with Boeing.

title: Pension Agency Wary of UAL Deal
description: United Airlines parent UAL Corp. and leaders of its pilots union have agreed on a deal under which the pilots will not oppose termination of their pension plan but will receive a \$550 million note convertible into company stock when the airline emerges from bankruptcy protection.

title: J amp;J biggest acquisition in its history will reshape the medical <b>...</b>
description: Johnson  amp; Johnson has made a deal to buy Guidant Corp. a producer of medical equipment for patients with heart and circulatory illnesses, for \$24 billion in stock and cash.

description: EDS #39;s effort to build the Navy and Marine Corps Intranet has been plagued by problems ever since the services vendor won the original \$6.

title: Pakistan to consider Indian diesel export offer
description: NEW DELHI: Pakistan will consider India #39;s offer of diesel export to boost cooperation on the energy front, said Pakistan Foreign Minister Khurshid Mehmood Kasuri here Monday.

title: Infineon to pay \$160 million fine for DRAM price-fixing
description: Infineon Technologies AG, a German manufacturer of DRAM (dynamic RAM) has agreed to plead guilty and pay a US\$160 million fine for attempting to fix prices in the DRAM market, the US Department of Justice (DOJ) announced Wednesday.

title: Update 1: Telstra Announces CEO Departure
description: Australia #39;s largest listed company, telecommunications giant Telstra Corp., announced Wednesday that its chief executive will stand down by July 2005 - two years before his contract ends.

title: Windows Users Want Results, Not Ballmer Promises
description: ORLANDO, Fla.Windows users said actions speak louder than words when it comes to Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer #39;s promise that Microsoft will fix the various security vulnerabilities in his company #39;s computing platform.

description: The EU says competition is bad, especially if it might produce a winner.

title: Vertex Gains on Novartis Deal

title: US Airways to Request Court-Ordered Pay Cuts
description: Attorneys for US Airways hope to convince a bankruptcy court judge in Alexandria today that without substantial pay cuts, the airline will go out of business.

title: Demand for Durable Goods Drops in August (AP)
description: AP - Orders to U.S. factories for big-ticket goods dropped in August, largely weighed down by a sharp decline in demand for commercial airplanes.

title: Starbucks to raise its prices beginning Oct. 6

description: MOSCOW, October 11 (Itar-Tass) -- Moscows Arbitration Court on Monday rejected the oil major YUKOS statement challenging the judge who is hearing the Tax Ministrys 40.

title: Cisco reports access control server flaws
description: Hackers could exploit the vulnerabilities to launch DOS attacks and bypass user authentication on the servers.

title: R.E. Lapp, 87, Physicist in Cold-War Debate on Civil Defense, Dies
description: Ralph E. Lapp was involved in atomic weapons from the earliest days of the Manhattan Project, and spoke out about the health effects of radiation into the 1990's.

title: Microsoft Order Cancelled by Beijing
description: The Chinese city of Beijing has cancelled an order for Microsoft software, apparently bowing to protectionist sentiment. The deal has come under fire in China, which is trying to build a domestic software industry.

title: Justices Affirm Do-Not-Call Ruling
description: The Supreme Court turned away a challenge Monday to the federal do-not-call registry, ending telemarketers' bid to invoke free-speech arguments to get the popular ban on unwanted phone solicitations thrown out. <FONT face="verdana,MS Sans Serif,arial,helvetica" size="-2" color="#666666"><B>-AP</B></FONT>

description: For the third straight quarter, shipments of handheld devices fell as some prominent vendors decided to pull back from the market, according to research firm IDC.

title: Court: Cos. Not Liable for Online Abuses (AP)
description: AP - In a judicial blow to the entertainment industry, a federal appeals court ruled that makers of two leading file-sharing programs are not legally liable for the songs, movies and other copyright works their users swap online.

title: IBM launches Atlantic

title: Infocus: Detecting Rootkits And Kernel-level Compromises In Linux
description: This article outlines useful ways of detecting hidden modifications to a Linux kernel. Often known as rootkits, these stealthy types of malware are installed in the kernel and require special techniques by Incident handlers and Linux system administrators to be detected.

title: Here Comes the Sun (The Motley Fool)
description: The Motley Fool - No, the U.S. is not on the verge of a solar revolution, and sunshine won't provide the country with "energy independence" anytime soon. But solar power is gaining momentum, and based on current trends, that momentum will probably continue to build.

title: PayPal.com resumes operations after four-day service disruption
description: Online payment Web site PayPal.com was back in service late last night after a coding error disrupted service for four days.

title: Intel cancels TV chip project
description: SAN JOSE, Calif. In another change of plans, semiconductor giant Intel has canceled a project to develop a chip for projection T-Vs.

title: Bonds Trainer Says He Was Coerced, Threatened
description: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - The personal trainer to baseball  slugger Barry Bonds says investigators searched his home  without showing a warrant last year and made threatening  comments to him, his girlfriend and his young son.

description: IRVING, Texas-What could have been a breather had Dallas coach Bill Parcells gasping for air here Sunday afternoon at Texas Stadium.

title: Olympics were hardly a total loss for Harris
description: His team won only twice in Athens, but one of those victories was pure hoop ambrosia for Del Harris. And this is a man who has coached basketball at various locales for 44 years, guiding the likes of Moses Malone, Shaquille O'Neal, and Sidney Moncrief along the way.

title: Inter Milan seeks redemption win against Juventus

title: Melvin faces major challenge in rebuilding Arizona
description: After the Wally Backman fiasco, the Arizona Diamondbacks were fortunate to have a handy and willing backup choice in Bob Melvin. The low-key Melvin so coveted the managing job that he brushed aside any concern about being the team #39;s second choice.

title: Shaq Wins Home Debut
description: Shaquille O'Neal scores 17 points and Dwyane Wade adds 28 as the Heat defeat the Cavaliers 92-86 in Shaq's home debut with Miami.

title: Raptors 101, Pistons 89
description: Loren Woods had 17 points and a career-high 14 rebounds, and Vince Carter scored seven of 12 points in the final three minutes to help the Toronto Raptors improve to 2-0 with a 101-89 victory over the Detroit Pistons on Friday night.

title: Grace Park leads them a merry dance in Korea

description: Australian Casey Stoner turned his wretched luck around to win the Malaysian 125cc Motorcycle Grand Prix yesterday, just six days before his 19th birthday.

description: SYDNEY (Reuters) - Arnold Palmer has taken a swing at  America's top players, criticizing their increasing reluctance  to travel abroad to play in tournaments.

title: Shoulder injury blow for Real #39;s Zidane
description: Real Madrid says French play-maker Zinedine Zidane will be out for at least three weeks after dislocating his right shoulder in their 3-0 Champions League defeat to Bayer Leverkusen in Germany.

title: US citizen jailed for Libya ties
description: A US citizen is jailed for 23 years for illegal financial dealings linked to an alleged plot by Libya to kill the Saudi Crown Prince.

description: A Palestinian militant has been killed and three other people wounded in an Israeli helicopter strike on a car in the southern Gaza Strip.

description: Rock singer Bono pledges to spend the rest of his life trying to eradicate extreme poverty around the world.

description: Controversial Islamic cleric Abu Hamza will appear at the Old Bailey today charged with a string of offences including soliciting murder.

description: 13 September 2004 -- US aircraft and artillery struck targets in the central Iraqi city of Al-Fallujah today, killing at least 15 people.

title: US denies Saddam on hunger strike
description: The US military denies reports Saddam Hussein is on hunger strike, but says some former aides are refusing food.

title: Myanmar releases 500 prisoners
description: The Myanmar government released about 500 prisoners from the notorious Insein Prison Friday, witnesses said. There was no immediate word, however, on whether political detainees were among them.

title: Iran wants to exempt centrifuges from nuclear freeze
description: It wants to be allowed to operate dozens of centrifuges  quot;for research purposes quot; -- an activity banned under a uranium enrichment freeze Iran just agreed to.

title: * Norway seriously concerned over factional killings
description: Sept 29, Colombo: The Norwegian government has expressed serious concern over the political killings in Sri Lanka. Norwegian Ambassador in Colombo Hans Brattskar made this statement when he met SP Tamilselvan

title: World Trade Center Leaseholder Gets Boost From Federal Jury
description: A jury has decided that the destruction of the World Trade Center was two events, meaning leaseholder Larry Silverstein can collect twice from insurance companies.

title: Five Malaysian sailors in Spratly bird flu scare
description: KUALA LUMPUR : Five Malaysian navy sailors have been hospitalised for bird flu tests after possibly coming into contact with diseased birds while patrolling the disputed Spratly islands, officials said on Friday.

title: Chaos as thousands swarm Arafat burial
description: By Philippe Naughton, Times Online, and Stephen Farrell in Ramallah. Yassir Arafat was laid to rest in the West Bank city of Ramallah today amid a chaotic send-off from the people he had led as fighter and figurehead for almost four decades.

description: A demonstration by pro-hunt campaigners is being held outside Peter Hain's home in south Wales.

title: Annan Warns Falluja Assault Could Spoil Elections

title: Afghan Campaign Picks Up as Karzai Heads to Berlin
description: KABUL (Reuters) - Afghan President Hamid Karzai's deputies  campaigned for him Saturday ahead of presidential elections  seven days away, while the candidate himself prepared to fly to  Germany to collect an international award.

title: Israel Kills 14 in Gaza Before Key Withdrawal Vote
description: GAZA (Reuters) - Israeli troops killed 14 Palestinians in a  Gaza refugee camp Monday as parliament prepared, under tight  security, to debate Prime Minister Ariel Sharon's plan to  withdraw from the occupied territory.

title: Atomic confession no bar to talks
description: TOKYO: Japan, South Korea, and the US have agreed six-nation talks on North Korea #39;s nuclear drive would take place this month as planned, despite Seoul #39;s admission of secret atomic research, a Japanese official said.

title: Stocks Climb Despite Rise in Oil Prices

title: Rebels Set Off Land mine in Indian Kashmir, 11 Dead
description: SRINAGAR, India (Reuters) - Separatist militants detonated  a powerful land mine in Indian Kashmir killing eleven people,  including nine soldiers in one of the biggest attacks in recent  weeks, police said on Sunday.

title: Chile Wins Trade Sanctions Against U.S.
description: <p></p><p> GENEVA (Reuters) - Chile on Friday became the eighth memberof the World Trade Organization (WTO) to win the right to hitthe United States with sanctions over an illegal anti-dumpinglaw known as the Byrd amendment.</p>

title: CIA Documents: U.S. Knew of Venezuela Coup
description: The U.S. Central Intelligence Agency knew dissident military officers were planning a coup in 2002 against Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez, according to purported U.S. intelligence documents posted on the Internet.

title: Analysis: Tensions over northern Iraq
description: Not for the first time, events in Iraq are straining relations between two traditionally close allies, Turkey and the United States.

title: Sharon Says Will Seek Coalition with Labor (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Israeli Prime Minister Ariel Sharon\said Thursday he would seek a coalition with Shimon Peres's\Labor Party and pledged to press ahead with a planned Gaza\pullout.
